docs.lead_paragraph: The project for a subway through Fourth Avenue, Brooklyn, planned and approved by the Public Service Commission, has been put off for several months through the taxpayers action instituted by Controller Metz, argument on which was heard in the Supreme Court yesterday by Justice Blanchard, who reserved decision.

headline.main: FOURTH AV. SUBWAY PUT OFF FOR MONTHS; Court Declines to Pass on Injunction Before Last Estimate Board Meeting. MAYOR WANTS A REFEREE Says Debt Limit of City Should Be Definitely Fixed Before New Work Is Contracted For.

docs.abstract: 4th Av subway put off for months through Metz's actions
